pullRequest.body:
This PR adds more analogues of operations on `Fin` tuples to the `Finsupp` setting. Before, there were only `Finsupp.cons` and `Finsupp.tail`. Now there are also `Finsupp.snoc`, `Finsupp.insertNth`, `Finsupp.init`, and `Finsupp.removeNth`. These all come with supporting lemmas.

I also removed the porting comment about `succAboveCases` in `Data/Fin/Basic`, and added a lemma about `succAbove` in `Data/Fin/Tuple/Basic`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

No significant changes to the import graph

|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ eq_self_or_eq_succAbove`
`+ init`
`+ init_apply`
`+ init_snoc`
`+ init_update_castSucc`
`+ init_update_last`
`+ insertNth`
`+ insertNth_apply_same`
`+ insertNth_apply_succAbove`
`+ insertNth_eq_insertNth`
`+ insertNth_injective2`
`+ insertNth_last`
`+ insertNth_left_injective`
`+ insertNth_ne_zero_iff`
`+ insertNth_ne_zero_of_left`
`+ insertNth_ne_zero_of_right`
`+ insertNth_removeNth`
`+ insertNth_self_removeNth`
`+ insertNth_support`
`+ insertNth_zero`
`+ insertNth_zero_zero`
`+ prod_insertNth`
`+ removeNth`
`+ removeNth_apply`
`+ removeNth_last`
`+ removeNth_update`
`+ removeNth_zero`
`+ snoc`
`+ snoc_castSucc`
`+ snoc_eq_snoc`
`+ snoc_init_self`
`+ snoc_injective2`
`+ snoc_last`
`+ snoc_ne_zero_iff`
`+ snoc_ne_zero_of_left`
`+ snoc_ne_zero_of_right`
`+ snoc_right_injective`
`+ snoc_support`
`+ snoc_zero_zero`
`+ sum_insertNth`
`+ sum_insertNth'`
`+ tail_init_eq_init_tail`
`+ tail_update_succ`
`+ tail_update_zero`
`++ insertNth_right_injective`
`++ snoc_left_injective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (0.48, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|5032|-2|porting notes|
|4883|1|exceptions for the docPrime linter|

Current commit [0695975d05](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/0695975d056b9ace4cd8332be38e27fd8aa0aed3)
Reference commit [de39dd8ecf](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/de39dd8ecfea9b240dede98cdbbedf44f906a37f)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

My use case is a bit indirect; it's in generalizing `MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv` to work on an arbitrary pivot:
```
def MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv' (p : Fin (n + 1)) :
    MvPolynomial (Fin (n + 1)) R ≃ₐ[R] Polynomial (MvPolynomial (Fin n) R) :=
  (renameEquiv R (_root_.finSuccEquiv' p)).trans (optionEquivLeft R (Fin n))
```

As I tried to prove theorems about this definition, I realized I needed the `Finsupp` definition of `insertNth`. And from there I figured might as well add all the variants.

Ah, then may I suggest that you generalise `finSuccEquiv` even more? The most general version wouldn't mention `Fin` at all, but rather two types `α` and `β`, a map `f : α → β` as well as an element `b : β` and a proof that `Set.range f = {b}ᶜ`
I see, yeah I can do that. Is there a name for this set-theoretic equivalence already in Mathlib?
Not sure, no. Also please ask people's opinions on Zulip before you actually try implementing my idea

I've fixed the pivot variable naming. To your point about generalizing `MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv`, I think that there is already a good generalization available: 
```
MvPolynomial.optionEquivLeft: MvPolynomial (Option S₁) R ≃ₐ[R] Polynomial (MvPolynomial S₁ R)
```
and in fact `MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv` uses this definition.

Yes, I am aware of this `Option` thinb, but somehow you still have to identify `Fin (n + 1)` with `Option (Fin n)` in various ways to get what you want, meaning that you would still need the extra definitions in this PR. I was hoping we could bypass all of that
For ease of reviewing, could you split off to a dependency file all lemmas that don't rely on those new definitions?
What's your use case?
For ease of reviewing, could you split off to a dependency file all lemmas that don't rely on those new definitions?

Please always try calling `p` the first argument to `succAbove`, as its the **p**ivot and doesn't play the same role at all as the second argument.
```suggestion
theorem eq_self_or_eq_succAbove (p i : Fin (n + 1)) : i = p ∨ ∃ j, i = p.succAbove j :=
```
Here and everywhere else

```suggestion
theorem tail_apply : tail s j = s j.succ := rfl
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Finsupp/Fin): Add `Finsupp` operations on `Fin` tuples
